description: From Middle English bērdlēs, from Old English beardlēas (“beardless”), from Proto-West Germanic *bardalaus (“beardless”), equivalent to beard +‎ -less. Cognate with Scots berdles (“beardless”), Saterland Frisian boartloos (“beardless”), West Frisian burdleas (“beardless”), Dutch baardeloos (“beardless”), German Low German baartlos (“beardless”), German bartlos (“beardless”).

adjectives.description: beardless (comparative more beardless, superlative most beardless)

entries.meaning: (by extension, of a male) Not having reached puberty or manhood; youthful.
examples: Cocker'd silken wanton, brave our fields,
And flesh his spirit in a warlike soil,
Mocking the air with colours idly spread,

entries.meaning: (ornithology) Lacking a beard (a defined patch of feathers below the beak).
